quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 14 Quiz 3
quiz.subtitle: 14.3: Identity Matrices and Inverse Matrices
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Finding the inverse of a 2x2 matrix

questions.question: Which of the following is the $2 \times 2$ Identity Matrix?
questions.explanation: The identity matrix must have 1s on the main diagonal (top-left to bottom-right) and 0s everywhere else.

questions.question: What is the value of the determinant ($ad - bc$) for which a matrix has NO inverse?
questions.explanation: If the determinant is 0, the formula $1/(ad-bc)$ would require division by zero, making the inverse undefined.

questions.question: To find the adjoint (the matrix part of the inverse) of $\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$, what steps are taken?
options: Swap $a$ and $d$, and change the signs of $b$ and $c$.
Swap $b$ and $c$, and change the signs of $a$ and $d$.
Transpose the matrix and square every element.
questions.explanation: The standard procedure for a $2 \times 2$ matrix is to swap the main diagonal elements and negate the off-diagonal elements.

questions.question: Find the inverse of $A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 7 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$. (Note: det = 1).
questions.explanation: The determinant is $(2 \times 4) - (1 \times 7) = 1$. Swapping $a$ and $d$ gives 4 and 2. Negating $b$ and $c$ gives -1 and -7.

questions.question: Which of the following matrices is 'singular' (has no inverse)?
questions.explanation: The determinant of the first matrix is $(2 \times 2) - (4 \times 1) = 0$. Therefore, it is singular.

questions.question: If $A \times X = B$, how do you isolate the matrix $X$ using the inverse of $A$?
questions.explanation: Since matrix multiplication is non-commutative, you must multiply by $A^{-1}$ on the left side of both sides of the equation.

questions.question: What is $(A^{-1})^{-1}$ equal to?
questions.explanation: The inverse of an inverse matrix brings you back to the original matrix $A$.

questions.question: Find the inverse of $\begin{bmatrix} 5 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$.
questions.explanation: Det = 5. Swapping diagonal gives $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 5 \end{bmatrix}$. Multiplying by $1/5$ gives the result.

questions.question: What is the product of a matrix and its inverse, $A \times A^{-1}$?
questions.explanation: By definition, a matrix multiplied by its inverse yields the multiplicative identity (the Identity Matrix).

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You can confidently calculate inverses and identify singular matrices.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember: det = 0 means no inverse exists.
scoreMessages.50: Practice the formula: swap the main diagonal, negate the others, and divide by the determinant.
scoreMessages.0: Review the definition of the Identity Matrix and the 2x2 determinant formula.
